topic.title: Re-Using an Existing 2.v Configuration for a new 3.0 Installation

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The example configurations have changed significantly in compared to those in version 2.x. Many new services have been added while some been changed or removed, so if you are doing a clean install of , it may be easier to start with the new example files and then localize and customize them to suit your set-up.

However, if you have already made a significant effort in creating configuration files for a version 2.x deployment, you can re-use these files when performing a clean installation, making some minor changes as outlined below.
Note that your new cloud will not have the services that are newly supported in . You can see how to add these services in the Installation documentation here and the Upgrade documentation here.

section.title: Ceilometer
section.p: A number of Ceilometer services have changed between version 2 and version 3:

ul.li: ceiloemeter-agent-central has been replaced by ceilometer-polling

section.p: When installs, it will automatically uninstall ceiloemeter-agent-central and install ceilometer-polling. You will need to update your configuration files to remove the three obsolete services so that the Configuration Processor will not issue deprecation warnings.

section.title: DNS Service (Designate)
section.p: Your cloud will run without Designate in control plane. If you want to use Designate, you should be aware that it requires configuration before the installation. Refer to the for instructions on how to setup and configure the DNS Service.

section.title: Load Balancer Service (Octavia)
section.p: Your cloud will run without Octavia in control plane.

section.title: Ceph
section.p: The example configuration for Entry-scale KVM with Ceph has changed in to use a three network model by default. If you choose to re-use your existing configuration, ceph based clouds will run with that configuration and will not switch to use the new default three network model.
RADOS Gateway nodes have been added to the Entry-scale KVM with Ceph model in . If you choose to re-use your existing configuration, your cloud will run without RADOS Gateway.
